name: UNO
overview: Uno is a card game played with a specially printed deck (see Mau Mau for an almost identical game played with normal playing cards). The game was originally developed in 1971 by Merle Robbins. It is now a Mattel product. The game's general principles put it into the Crazy Eights family of card games. The Sony PlayStation version of the game features 11 different characters for the players to choose, and 2 different game modes: Quick Game & Story Mode. The game was later re-released by Success as part of their SuperLite 1500 budget series.
